Site to Site

A4819 & A4822
Fall 2013











Architecture is online

But architects are not equipped to design for it

The Stakes

Platform wars are being waged for virtual space

The market for physical space is even greater

A silent war is underway between companies you've likely never heard of to determine the meta-design for the connected, responsive architecture of the very near future

Rather than join a side, we're assembling an army

Methodology

Flickr API (2004)

Mappr by Stamen (2004)

The Flickr API has since provided the foundation for numerous apps and mashups

As of August 30, 2013, there were 9878 APIs registered in the Programmable Web database, allowing you to tap into almost anything

Architecture has yet to adopt this ethos

We will build an Architecture API to tap into these:

Partnership

Working in tandem with the seminar Corporate Avant Garde (A6453), we will take a hypothetical construct as our object: the US Pavilion in Venice as the site for an architecture office, OfficeUS
